Delay Utility Functions
utils

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides delay utility functions for timing control across Ambiq Micro devices. It enables accurate software delays, cycle counting, and timing operations for embedded applications requiring precise timing control. The utilities support both microsecond and millisecond delays with calibration options.

Key Features

  1. Cycle Delays: Precise cycle-based timing control.
  2. Millisecond Delays: High-level millisecond delay functions.
  3. Microsecond Delays: Precise microsecond timing operations.
  4. Frequency Adaptive: Automatic timing adjustment based on system clock.
  5. Device Specific: Optimized implementations for different Apollo families.
  6. Power Efficient: Low-power delay operations for battery applications.

Functionality

  • Provide cycle-based delay functions for precise timing
  • Support millisecond and microsecond delay operations
  • Adapt timing based on system clock frequency
  • Optimize delays for different Apollo device families
  • Enable power-efficient timing operations
  • Support hardware-specific delay implementations
  • Provide consistent timing across device variations
  • Handle clock frequency variations automatically

Usage

  1. Use am_util_delay_cycles() for precise cycle-based delays
  2. Call am_util_delay_ms() for millisecond timing
  3. Use am_util_delay_us() for microsecond precision
  4. System automatically adapts to device clock frequency
  5. No manual configuration required for different devices

Configuration

  • Device Support: Apollo3, Apollo4, Apollo5 family compatibility
  • Clock Detection: Automatic system clock frequency detection
  • Hardware Optimization: Device-specific delay implementations
  • Power Management: Low-power delay operations
  • Timing Precision: Cycle-accurate timing control

◆ am_util_delay_cycles()

void am_util_delay_cycles ( uint32_t ui32Iterations)

Delays for a desired amount of loops.

This function will delay for a number of cycle loops.

Note
- the number of cycles each loops takes to execute is approximately 3. Therefore the actual number of cycles executed will be ~3x ui32Iterations.

For example, a ui32Iterations value of 100 will delay for 300 cycles.

Parameters
ui32Iterations- Desired number of cycle loops to delay for.
